messages.title: John Curtice: Polls teeter between hung parliament and slim Tory majority
messages.content: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Organised export seminars and campaigned for faster broadband.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Delivering an outstanding education for all our children
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supported parent groups to set up the Wren School and All Saints Junior School.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Campaigning for better accessibility at local rail stations
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Won millions for local transport projects and delivered more standard class train seats.
Campaigning for a change in law and more police, with 183 new officers announced for Thames Valley Police.
Successfully campaigned to keep the hydrotherapy pool at Royal Berkshire Hospital.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Championing sustainable housing with additional local infrastructure
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Protecting the environment and green spaces like Pincents Hill.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists. And they’re demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain. That’s five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.

issues.education: Delivering an outstanding education for all our children, having supported parent groups to set up the Wren School and All Saints Junior School.
issues.environment: Championing sustainable housing with additional local infrastructure, whilst protecting our environment and green spaces like Pincents Hill.
issues.health: Improving local NHS services, having campaigned successfully to keep the hydrotherapy pool at Royal Berkshire Hospital.
issues.labourEmployment: Supporting high-quality jobs locally, having organised export seminars and campaigned for faster broadband.
issues.lawCrime: Campaigning for a change in law to tackle illegal encampments and for more police, with 183 new officers recently announced for Thames Valley Police.
issues.transport: Continuing to campaign for better accessibility at local rail stations, having already won millions for local transport projects and delivered more standard class train seats.

community.content: Championing sustainable housing with additional local infrastructure, whilst protecting our environment and green spaces like Pincents Hill.

examples: Polls teeter between hung parliament and slim Tory majority
183 new officers recently announced for Thames Valley Police.
Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools.

A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists. And they’re demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain. That’s five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.
Let's get on with our priorities.
Delivering an outstanding education for all our children
Campaigning for better accessibility at local rail stations
At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.
Campaigning for a change in law to tackle illegal encampments
Championing sustainable housing with additional local infrastructure
A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists.
